BodyName: Committee on Women and Gender Equity
Comment: Jointly with the Committee on Mental Health, Disabilities and Addiction.

Items.Title: Oversight - Physical and Mental Health Supports for New and Expecting Parents.
Items.ActionText: This Oversight was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Oversight - Physical and Mental Health Supports for New and Expecting Parents.

Items.Title: Jointly with the Committee on Mental Health, Disabilities and Addiction

A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of health and mental hygiene to create pamphlets identifying mental health resources available to individuals experiencing pregnancy loss
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Requiring the department of health and mental hygiene to create pamphlets identifying mental health resources available to individuals experiencing pregnancy loss.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to a public campaign on parental mental health resources
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Public campaign on parental mental health resources.

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to implementing a pilot program to establish postpartum support groups
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Implementing a pilot program to establish postpartum support groups.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, legislation to require health insurance plans to develop and implement a maternal mental health quality management program to promote access to affordable and comprehensive maternal mental health services.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Require health insurance plans to develop and implement a maternal mental health quality management program to promote access to affordable and comprehensive maternal mental health services

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, legislation mandating all accredited psychiatry residency programs to offer a one-year, post-residency fellowship program specifically focused on Perinatal Mental Health (PMH).
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Mandating all accredited psychiatry residency programs to offer a one-year, post-residency fellowship program specifically focused on Perinatal Mental Health.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, legislation to require obstetricians and gynecologists (OBGYNs) to conduct maternal mental health screening during pregnancy and postpartum, and to require Medicaid to cover such services
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Require obstetricians and gynecologists (OBGYNs) to conduct maternal mental health screening during pregnancy and postpartum, and to require Medicaid to cover such services.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, legislation mandating Medicaid Managed Care Organizations to collect and report prenatal and postpartum depression screenings and follow-up data using HEDIS measures.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Mandating Medicaid Managed Care Organizations to collect and report prenatal and postpartum depression screenings and follow-up data using HEDIS measures.

Items.Title: Resolution designating May annually as Maternal Mental Health Awareness Month in the City of New York and calling on the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, S.156/A.6603, which would make the same designation Statewide.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Designating May annually as Maternal Mental Health Awareness Month in the City of New York. (S.156/A.6603)

Items.Title: Resolution declaring May 28 as Menstrual Hygiene Day in the City of New York.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Declaring May 28 as Menstrual Hygiene Day in the City of New York.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York City Department of Education to permit students excused absences while experiencing symptoms of menstrual disorders.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Department of Education to permit students excused absences while experiencing symptoms of menstrual disorders.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York City Department of Education to create a training program for school nurses and physicians to learn about endometriosis, including formation on systemic racism, bias, and racial and gender-based disparities related to the condition.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Department of Education to create a training program for school nurses and physicians to learn about endometriosis, including formation on systemic racism, bias, and racial and gender-based disparities related to the condition.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, S.322/A.7454, the Chisholm Chance Act, which would establish a plan to address the severe maternal morbidity crisis in Brooklyn and the Bronx.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Chisholm Chance Act (S.322/A.7454)

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, legislation to ease systemic barriers in opening birth centers in New York City and New York State
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Ease systemic barriers in opening birth centers in New York City and New York State.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, legislation to increase Medicaid reimbursement to cover eight pre- and post-natal visits, as well as delivery support by doulas.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Increase Medicaid reimbursement to cover eight pre- and post-natal visits, as well as delivery support by doulas.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to supporting lactating individuals
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Supporting lactating individuals.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to establishing a screening program for endometriosis and polycystic ovarian syndrome
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Establishing a screening program for endometriosis and polycystic ovarian syndrome.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to information about the maternal mortality and morbidity review committee
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Information about the maternal mortality and morbidity review committee.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of social services to develop parenting resource materials and the department of health and mental hygiene to distribute such materials to new parents and guardians and to make available on their website information about community-based organizations that support maternal health
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Requiring the dept of social services to develop parenting resource materials and the dept of health and mental hygiene to distribute such materials to new parents and guardians and to make available on their website information about community-based orga

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to prohibiting the sale of menstrual and intimate care products that contain unsafe ingredients
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Prohibiting the sale of menstrual and intimate care products that contain unsafe ingredients.

Items.Title: Roll Call

Items.MinutesNote: Other Council Members Attending: Farías, Lee, Bottcher, Mealy, Brewer, Abreu, Hanif and Marmorato
